Developing a Portable Block Testbench and Reusable SOC Verification Scenarios Using IP-XACT Based Automation

Tae Jin Kim, Tae Hee Han

Mar 2020

Abstract

This paper presents a portable block testbench architecture for the development of reusable SOC verification scenarios, and automated testbench generation by using IP-XACT. We explain how the portable block testbench is composed to improve the reusability of verification scenarios from the sub-system level to the SOC level. Next, we describe a way to automate portable block testbench generation for entire blocks in the SOC using IP-XACT. We applied this framework to our verification flow of premium SOC design. As a result, we can achieve an average simulation run time reduction of 65%~95%.
